required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on July 28, 2020
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Prospective Registry of Mobilization-, Routine- and Outcome Data of Intensive Care Patients
clinical_study.official_title: Prospective Registry of Mobilization-, Routine- and Outcome Data of Intensive Care Patients

brief_summary.textblock: Registry database of intensive care patients. These data comprises of routine data including mobilization data and follow up assessments.

detailed_description.textblock:
Registry database of intensive care patients. These data comprises of routine data including mobilization data and follow up assessments.
The database is supposed to help quality improvement as well as

primary_outcome.time_frame: At hospital discharge, on average within 1 month
primary_outcome.description: Physical function at ICU discharge with either the mmFIM (minimal modified Functional Independence Measure) or the Barthel subdomains transfer, locomotion and climbing stairs

secondary_outcome.time_frame: At hospital discharge, on average within 1 month

secondary_outcome.description: Pre-ICU Function assessed with the WHODAS 2.0 (World Health Organisation's Disability Assessment Schedule), EQ5D (European Quality of Life 5 Dimensions 5 Level) and work details
Global function of the patient assessed with the WHODAS 2.0 (World Health Organisation's Disability Assessment Schedule)
Physical function of the patient assessed with the IADL (The Lawton Instrumental Activities of Daily Living)

secondary_outcome.measure: Quality of Life of the patient
secondary_outcome.description: Quality of Life of the patient assessed with the EQ5D (European Quality of Life 5 Dimensions 5 Level)
Cognitive Function assessed with the MoCA blind (Montreal Cognitive Assessment)
Anxiety and Depression assessed with the IES-R (Impact of Event Scale - Revised) and HADS (Hospital Anxiety and Depression scale)
Return to work assessed with the WHODAS 2.0 (World Health Organisation's Disability Assessment Schedule)

secondary_outcome.time_frame: At ICU Discharge, on average within 2 weeks
At ICU Discharge, on average within 2 weeks
secondary_outcome.description: Physical function at ICU discharge with either the mmFIM (minimal modified Functional Independence Measure) or the Barthel subdomains transfer, locomotion and climbing stairs

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Intensive care unit stay > 24 hours
Exclusion Criteria:
-

facility.name: Klinikum rechts der Isar der TUM

clinical_study.keyword: early mobilization, intensive care, longterm outcomes

patient_data.ipd_description: Sharing of anonymous data might be possible on reasonable scientific request.
